ls -l - List with detailed file info
ls -a - List all files including hidden
ls -lh - List files with human-readable sizes
date - Display current date and time
uptime - Show how long the system has been running
alias - Show list of defined aliases
chmod u+x [file] - Add execute permission for owner
chmod g-w [file] - Remove write permission for group
chmod o+r [file] - Add read permission for others
chmod 755 [file] - Set file permissions using numeric mode
umask - Show or set default file permissions
ip addr show - Show IP addresses
ip route show - Display routing table
ping [host] - Send ICMP echo requests to host
ping -c [count] [host] - Send specific number of pings
netstat -tuln - Show listening ports and services
ss -tuln - Show listening ports with socket statistics
ssh [user@host] - Connect to remote host via SSH
nmcli - Command-line interface for managing NetworkManager
nmcli device show - Show all network devices
nmcli connection up [name] - Activate a network connection
nmcli connection down [name] - Deactivate a network connection
groups [username] - Show groups a user belongs to
id [username] - Display user and group IDs
who - Show who is logged in
w - Show who is logged in and what they are doing
visudo - Edit sudoers file to configure sudo access
apt install [package] - Install a new package
apt search [term] - Search for a package
yum search [term] - Search for a package
yum list installed - List installed packages
mkfs.ext4 [device] - Format device with ext4 filesystem
kill [pid] - Terminate a process by PID
pgrep [name] - Find process ID by name
nice -n [priority] [command] - Run a command with a specific priority
renice [priority] [pid] - Change the priority of a running process
fg [job] - Bring a background job to the foreground
bg [job] - Send a job to the background
nohup [command] & - Run a command immune to hangups
systemctl start [service] - Start a systemd service
systemctl stop [service] - Stop a systemd service
systemctl restart [service] - Restart a systemd service
systemctl status [service] - Check the status of a service
systemctl enable [service] - Enable a service at startup
systemctl disable [service] - Disable a service at startup
service [service] start - Start a service (older systems)
service [service] stop - Stop a service (older systems)
service [service] status - Check service status (older systems)
tar -czvf [archive.tar.gz] [files] - Create a gzipped tar archive
tar -xzvf [archive.tar.gz] - Extract a gzipped tar archive
zip [archive.zip] [files] - Compress files into a zip archive
gzip [file] - Compress a file with gzip
bzip2 [file] - Compress a file with bzip2
grep [pattern] [file] - Search for pattern in file
grep -r [pattern] [directory] - Recursively search for pattern in directory
awk '{print $1}' [file] - Print first column of a file
uniq [file] - Remove duplicate lines in file
cut -d',' -f1 [file] - Cut first field from CSV file
head [file] - Show first 10 lines of file
tail [file] - Show last 10 lines of file
tail -f [file] - Follow changes in file in real-time
cat [file1] [file2] > [newfile] - Concatenate two files into a new file
tr 'a-z' 'A-Z' < [file] - Translate lowercase to uppercase in file
iostat - Display CPU and disk usage
mpstat - Display CPU usage per core
watch [command] - Repeatedly run a command and display output
dmidecode - Show hardware information from BIOS
smartctl -a [device] - Show SMART information for a disk
docker ps - List running Docker containers
docker run [image] - Run a new Docker container
docker exec -it [container] bash - Open shell in running container
docker stop [container] - Stop a Docker container
docker rm [container] - Remove a Docker container
docker rmi [image] - Remove a Docker image
docker build -t [name] . - Build a Docker image from a Dockerfile
docker-compose up - Start containers with Docker Compose
docker-compose down - Stop and remove containers
vagrant up - Start a Vagrant virtual machine
vagrant halt - Stop a Vagrant virtual machine
vagrant destroy - Destroy a Vagrant virtual machine
whereis [command] - Locate command binary, source, and manual
xargs - Build and execute command lines from input
time [command] - Measure time taken to execute a command
sleep [seconds] - Delay execution for specified time
shutdown -h now - Shutdown the system immediately
wall [message] - Send a message to all users
dd if=[input] of=[output] bs=[blocksize] - Copy and convert files
